physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A large anterior mass was palpated on digital neovaginal examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 6 weeks of treatment, PSA level decreased to 77 ng/mL. Following radiation (week 17), PSA dropped to 4.6 ng/mL. At week 35, PSA level further decreased to 0.4 ng/mL, and MRI showed prostate size decreased to 4.5 x 3.4 x 3.7 cm.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Subsequent physical examination revealed a reduction in prostate size.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No new findings were specified at week 35; continued adherence to antiandrogen treatment led to stable PSA levels at 0.4 ng/mL.
No changes in PSA level were observed; it remained at 0.4 ng/mL.
